creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: large red wooden temple gate with gold details featured in center; two women in kimono, one with a parasol, walk down the stone steps at L, while a group of three near the R ascend the steps; a human figure stands just inside the gate; a male figure is seated with objects on and near his lap at the bottom of the stairs at R; foreground contains stone lanterns and walkway to the large gate; dense, lush foliage in background
marks: left margin, printed: [自摺  昭和拾六年作 金門 ] (self-print LLC: [ よし田 ] {Yoshida}; LRC, in pencil: [Hiroshi Y
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Gold Gate
